title: Darren Fletcher backs Marcus Rashford to 'click' against Liverpool
text:
Former Manchester United midfielder Darren Fletcher believes Marcus Rashford's season could burst into life against bitter rivals Liverpool on Sunday.

Rashford's underwhelming start to the season has mirrored United's woeful form on the pitch. He has scored just three goals all campaign with Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side 15 points behind Liverpool already.

But Fletcher, who played for United between 2003 and 2015, believes the visit of Jurgen Klopp's side could provide the perfect moment for Rashford and his team-mates to 'click'.

Darren Fletcher believes Marcus Rashford's season could burst into life against Liverpool

The Scottish midfielder thinks Sunday's match could be a turning points in Rashford's season

'I think he is feeling the pressure of that [being the main man] a little bit this season, you want to say to him "relax, don't try too hard", Fletcher told Sky Sports.

'We want him to try, obviously, but it's a case of not trying too hard - wait for your opportunities.

'I think for Marcus Rashford, like Manchester United, it could be the game that kick-starts the season.

'He's a real talisman and the goals and performances are in him, all it takes is something to click.'

Rashford has scored just three goals so far with Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side well off the pace

Rashford has become United's leading centre forward following the departure of Romelu Lukaku and the club's failure to replace him during the summer.

With Anthony Martial also having been out injured for a number of games this season, Rashford has been the only fit striker but has struggled to have any influence on matches.

Defeat by Newcastle last time out left United just two points off the relegation places after eight games.

Solskjaer's side are expected to add to their forward ranks in January with Juventus striker Mario Mandzukic a target.
